discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I would go with C. IPSec since... what everyone said along with the fact most of these answers tend to go with IPSec when it is an option.

I believe the distinction between PPTP and IPSec is that PPTP encrypts an entire packet in the GRE body while IPSec supports encrypting the payload. It looks like PPTP is "more correct"

questions.question_text: Which of the following protocols supports encapsulation of encrypted packets in secure wrappers that can be transmitted over a TCP/IP connection?
Which of the following user authentications are supported by the SSH-1 protocol but not by the SSH-2 protocol? Each correct answer represents a complete solution. Choose all that apply.

discussion.content:
ChatGPT
The user authentications supported by the SSH-1 protocol but not by the SSH-2 protocol are:

A. TIS authentication
B. Rhosts (rsh-style) authentication

Explanation:

SSH-1 supported TIS authentication and Rhosts authentication. However, these authentication methods are deprecated and considered insecure. SSH-2 focuses on more secure and robust authentication methods such as public key authentication, keyboard-interactive authentication, and GSSAPI (Kerberos) authentication.

C. Kerberos authentication is supported by both SSH-1 and SSH-2.
D. Password-based authentication is supported by both SSH-1 and SSH-2.

The PING command primarily tests Layer 3 (Network layer) of the OSI model. Therefore, the correct answer is:

A. Layer 3

Explanation:

PING operates at the Network layer (Layer 3) by using the Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) to send echo requests and receive echo replies.
Layers 1 and 2 (Physical and Data Link layers) are typically not directly tested by the PING command.
Layer 4 (Transport layer) is not directly tested by PING, as it is more focused on network layer connectivity.

questions.question_text: You work as a Network Administrator for McRoberts Inc. You are expanding your company's network. After you have implemented the network, you test the connectivity to a remote host by using the PING command. You get the ICMP echo reply message from the remote host. Which of the following layers of the OSI model are tested through this process? Each correct answer represents a complete solution. Choose all that apply.
